page.title: 05LOCAL HISTORY IN URCHFONT
page.content: Local history:Urchfont in the past. The mill down at Peppercombe was once owned by a Mr.James Stone.He was a man who used to grind the flour and make his wife push him and the flour in the wheelbarrow up the hill to the bakehouse which was in high street.The bakehouse is where Mr. Dradge lives now it was also another shop is where Miss.Brent lives now next to the post office was first a grocers shop then it was a hairdressers and now it is a house or dwelling.there was a shop next to the Lamb it was called a drapery shop.It used to sell buttons,cotton,tread and lace.A Miss. Merit kept it.There used to be a shop where the house with the big bay window is at the bottom of the green.That was another grocers shop.A Mrs.Harris kept that she had a milking shed at the back of her house where
